# Complexity analysis

## Big-$O$


::: {#def-}
Let $f(n)$ and $g(n)$ be functions from positive integers to positive reals.

- We say $f=O(g)$ if there exists a constant $c>0$ such that $f(n)\leq c\cdot g(n)$.
- We say $f=\Omega(g)$ if $g=O(f)$.
- We say $f=\Theta(g)$ if $f=O(g)$ and $f=\Omega(g)$.
:::
